inn1.comm: stands up tall and punched towards cover, no run though
that was a little uppish as Holder makes the batsman play this a little too early. Closed the face a little early, but he escapes
again pushed to extra cover
play and miss, just outside off stump as Ryder shuffles across and pokes at it. Good ball to start off with as the batsman was bereft of foot movement
that's a couple for Ryder as he strokes the ball through towards the cover boundary. Simmons drags it back before it reaches the rope
safely and watchfully defended to mid-off
bouncer, sails well above Ryder's head as he motioned to ducking underneath, but not quite completely.

there's the first boundary of the match and it comes off a full-flowing cover drive. Wasn't concentrating too much on foot movement, but his weight transfer forward is very good as the ball scurries off to the boundary
beaten outside off as he was trying to move back in his crease
moves back and punched to short cover by Guptill

loud appeal for leg before, Umpire Gould reckons it would have been slipping down leg as Holder gets this to nip in from outside off stump. It hit him a touch high as well while the batsmen was looking to flick it away
another checked sort of drive into the covers by Guptill
beaten again, this is quite good bowling from Holder as the keeper cleans up
short ball to finish as he cramps him up for room and Guptill can only block it away
does well again as Ryder is left hanging after poking at one outside off. Missed again
guided with an open face towards point
there's the second boundary from Ryder as this one goes across him and he slams it through cover again
worked away just forward of square leg for a single, Nikita Miller was the man there
comes forward as he nudges this towards backward point and Miller picks it up
mild appeal for leg before again, not too much conviction behind that. Rightly so because the umpire reckons there might be a bit of bat as this strikes him on the pads
thick inside edge sends the ball towards deep fine leg
dropped, put down by Denesh Ramdin, should have been taken that one, hits the fingers of the glove and that is a big miss from Ramdin, Holder can't believe that
punched off the back foot by Guptill
blocked out to the off side
defended to the off side once more to end the over, Holder 3-1-3-0
short of a length and plays that to the off side
Ryder stands tall and drops the ball towards gully
short of a length ball, worked towards midwicket for a single
short of a length, rising up, Guptill defends back towards the bowler
gets up on his toes and works this one to the leg side
Best keeps it back of a length, Guptill stands tall and tucks the ball towards midwicket
dropped, once more, straight in and straight out at slip, not that tough a chance, good height there, goes right through the hands of Dwayne Bravo, Ryder survives
off the pads and a leg bye as the ball dribbles to the leg side
eases this one towards mid-on
Ryder goes for the pull, connects well and sends that to the long-on boundary, that was a touch short from Holder, Ryder capitalises
into the body this time, defended towards the off side by Ryder
Ryder goes for the big shot through the off side, skews this high and down towards third man, wide of the fielder but still time only for a single, loose stroke from Ryder
punches this one to the off side, can't find the gap though
short of a lengthm Ryder looking to muscle it through the off side, mistimes it a bit and the ball rolls towards cover
leg stump delivery, blocked back towards the bowler
hooked away by Ryder, in the air for a bit but controlled shot down towards fine leg, that was dropped a touch short
Ryder smashes this one but can't beat cover and he gets a single
played off the back foot, hit firmly for a single towards cover point, Guptill doubles his score
worked to the off side, fielded by Walton, no run there
Guptill works this to the leg side, thinks about the single, but then decides against it
good timing but not so good placement from Guptill, punched towards cover
outside off, Guptill allows this one through to the keeper
outside off, he flails at that one, but it goes through to the keeper
badly timed drive, the ball rolls to the leg side, a maiden for Holder, Guptill can't change gears here it seems
gets an under edge as he flashes at a length ball outside off stump, falls short of Ramdin though
goes a touch wider outside off stump and this time Ryder's cut can't connect
hammers a length ball on the pads away over square leg for another very powerful boundary. Looks like he's decided there's only one way to play here
slashed over point and that's consecutive boundaries. This time he rides the bounce as Best goes short and uses the room outside off to get it up and over. Top shot
cross seam delivery at a fuller length on off stump as Ryder pushes to mid-off, minimal footwork again
easy two for Ryder as he drives this full length ball on off stump through the covers
too wide outside off and Guptill cannot reach, which is indication enough for the umpire to call it
much better as this is on a length outside off and Guptill is happy to leave it alone
little bit of shape away from the bat, but his line is a little too wide to tempt the batsman into a shot
good length ball, a lot closer to off stump and Guptill is wary of it as he lets it go
short and enough room to slap behind point for a single
"catch," they cry desperately to the man on the backward square leg boundary, but though Ryder had picked this off his hips rather well, it doesn't carry
room outside off again as he goes back and across and slams it to the man on the cover point boundary
length ball on the pads and its blocked back to the bowler
goes back and punches it to extra cover, who misfields allowing Ryder to come back for a couple
swung away to long leg for a single to retrain strike
early call for single and they pick it up easily as he opens the face and guides it towards point
thick bottom edge as Guptill chopped this shortish ball outside off stump to first slip
neat, it was a full length ball on middle as Guptill gets forward and clipped it to mid-on
good, quick single again as this length ball is nudged towards point off the front foot
fullish and absolutely no room and Ryder was originally planning to flay it through the covers, but had to check his shot. Gets a thick inside edge down the pitch
stays back and swings it away to long leg as this is shortish and on the pads
that's fifty for New Zealand as Ryder rocks back to punish a short ball with just a touch of width through the covers
goes back and punches it away down the ground for a single
bit of flight from Miller but he prefers to go back and block it
touch more flight which draws Guptill forward and he drives just wide of mid-off and picks up a single
Ryder was banking on the flight to slam the ball through the covers, but he finds short cover
whipped away towards midwicket for a single
length ball just outside off stump as Ryder goes forward and slaps it to point

they've finally got him finally. Excellent delivery on that off stump corridor and Ryder is drawn into pushing at it. His head snapped immediately back to the keeper, but this time Ramdin collects the edge safely and West Indies celebrate
starts off with a fullish one which seams further away after starting well outside off stump. The umpire doesn't like it and calls it wide
gets a little closer but he is still too far outside off to lure the new batsman into a shot
another beauty, this was angled in on a good length and then straightens even as Williamson leaned into a forward defensive. Too good for him
he's off the mark by tapping a full length ball on middle towards mid-on with soft hands
good-looking drive from Guptill, but he can't pierce the off side field as the fullish ball outside off is pushed straight to mid-off
chips down the track as he sees this tossed up on off stump and blocks
and he sensed this would be shorter as he remained on the back foot and steered it towards the covers
nudged down to long-on as this was full and on middle and leg
goes back and powers the length ball on the stumps to long-on again
flighted on middle as Williamson keeps his bat and pad close in defence
wanders down the track and drills the ball to the bowler, who can't get behind it. As the ball scurries away towards mid-off, he picks up an eventually easy single
fullish and outside off, Williamson is content leaving this be
good stuff from Bravo, he's getting closer towards off and is on a good length too. Williamson respects it with another leave
walks out to meet the fullish ball and he was allowing a reasonable view of all three stumps as he pushes down the ground
leans forward and blocks with soft hands towards point and Guptill responds to the quick single
beaten outside off as Guptill got forward and looked to defend. Touch of away movement and he's rather lucky not to get the edge. Very scratchy innings this

phew! Nothing scratchy about that. Length ball just a touch outside off stump, he plonks his front foot forward, gets under it and launches it straight over the top of the sightscreen. Magnificent strike.
chipped over the top on the off side as he charges down the track for a couple
full length ball on middle and leg as he drives back to the bowler
pushed to the left of Bravo as he leaned forward and opened the face of the bat on impact with the flighted ball on off
went back in his crease as this was a touch short and he opens up his shoulders in a punch through extra cover
steers it to short third man as he goes right forward and plays with soft hands
this time he cuts to deep point after going back to a length ball outside off stump
pushed down towards mid-off but the bowler runs over to field it himself
short, wide, ample room but though he found perfect timing, the ball goes straight to the man at cover. Touch unlucky?
short ball coming up just above his midriff as he swivels on the back foot and pulls it towards long leg for a single
fullish ball outside off as Williamson crouches in his crease and looks to cut it, but gets a thick bottom edge which goes on the bounce to the keeper
jumps across to the off stump as Bravo keeps this nice and full. Gets a touch of movement away as Williamson nudges it towards point
full and angling into him as he clips it to mid-on quite nicely
worked away to midwicket from the crease
it was fullish but on the pads and Guptill whips it away towards deep midwicket
he's not been shy of coming down the track, but Miller has seen him here and shortens the length so that Williamson can only defend
well played, that. Another chip down the track to reach the pitch of the ball and he just concentrates of beating the man in the infield and picks up a couple over cover
goes back and guides this towards short third man, lovely little late cut gets a single
drops it short here and Guptill is quick to latch on as he pulls this away to deep square leg
lots of flight for the first ball as he comes forward and defends
reaches forward and gets outside the line of the ball to turn it away to midwicket
draws Guptill forward again and this time he plays a good, solid drive through extra cover to pick up a couple
turns in from a full length as Guptill gets forward and nudges into the on side
holds this one back and Guptill was wise to it as he got deep in his crease and worked it away to square leg
straight bat keeps out the full length ball on middle
gets forward and blocks it to the bowler
steers this towards point with an open face and hurries through for a single
dabs towards point again and they pick up another single
oh, bit of extra extra bounce for Miller as this one lobs away towards where silly mid-off might have been
flighted outside off, defended away
turned away between midwicket and mid-on to retain strike
goes back and stands tall as he blocks the length ball
leans over his front leg and turns the ball away towards square leg for a single
turns in off a full length as he pushes down the ground, they were thinking of two, but the fielder had come in off the boundary a little too quickly
could probably have gone forward to that as he had to hurry into his stroke. But he manages to keep this inward turning delivery out
quicker ball on middle and leg as he punches to mid-on
uses his wrists to work this full length ball on leg stump away to the left of short fine leg
defended off the front boot back to the bowler
edged forward, but seeing this a touch short, he rocks back and slaps the ball behind point for a couple
another trip down the track, but this wasn't quite well controlled as the ball squirts off to short fine leg
gets forward and drives down to long-on
flighted on off stump as Guptill opens the face and drives into the covers
single to finish as he makes a little room to slap the short ball through to deep point
off spinner on the pads, though he did flight it rather nicely. Goes off the thigh pad and Williamson pulls him through for a single
oops, that was far too short and dealt with appropriately. Smart and swift footwork takes Williamson deep in his crease and he pulls the ball dead square to beat the deep fielder
stays back again and this time turns the ball through towards midwicket for a single
short outside off stump this time and Guptill cuts this between point and cover. He's got a good bat on that, but Charles pulls it back with a sliding stop. It was the knuckle ball too, well read
he goes one better, leaps back in his crease to make some room for himself to take advantage of another on that was a touch too short and slaps this behind point for four
pushed off the back foot to long-off as this is kept on a length outside off
flighted on middle and off which draws Guptill into a forward defensive
wanted the single but cover comes around and cuts off the drive through mid-off
this was angled in on the pads and he turns it away to deep square leg
a little dance down the track allows him to drive the flighted ball through the covers for a single
pushed through on middle and leg as Guptill goes back and pushes down the pitch
drives very nicely down the ground after he advanced from his crease to get to the pitch of the flighted ball on off stump
good stride forward again as he continues tossing the ball up on off stump and is driven towards cover
oh, dropped it short and Williamson had moved across to the off stump and pulls it behind square leg. Tino Best is down there and keeps it to two
stays full and Williamson moves forward, keeps bat and pad together and blocks
flicked away through to deep square leg again, good footwork again as he moved right back in his crease
a bit too short again, but this time a little brilliance from backward point prevents the boundary. It was chopped away rather powerfully but Miller leaps to his left and gets two hands to it
full on middle and leg is driven from the crease down to long-on
used his feet, as he has been doing all innings and this time he reached right to the pitch of it so playing against the turn was no problem as he slammed the ball over midwicket
stays back as this length ball is guided away off an open face fine of short third man
opens the face again, but it goes straight to the short third man fielder
full and on the pads as he turns it away through midwicket
dart on leg stump as Guptill pushed to mid-on
length ball pushed across on off stump as he punches it to long-off
length ball on off stump, but Williamson was making some room for himself and cuts towards cover
flighted delivery on middle and off as he goes forward and drives to long-off again
clips the length ball on middle to midwicket
neatly manoeuvred as this was on the pads and he paddled it wide of the short fine leg fielder
he's missed out there, it was short and had enough room, but perhaps he should have been trying to cut it instead of pull it away
flatter delivery that time and he chops it away behind point, there is a fumble at point which allows them a couple
pushed down the pitch off the back foot
goes back to cut the ball off the stumps and he gets a top edge that balloons through the vacant slip cordon
he finishes off with a yorker on off stump and Guptill gets his bat down in time
skips down the track and drives that inside-out towards extra cover
clips this towards deep midwicket
length ball on middle and leg stump, worked towards long-on this time

backs away from the stumps, chops that towards point where a sloppy effort from Nikita Miller concedes a boundary, that should have been a single, Miller doesn't get down as he tries to stop that, deflects off his hands
eased towards long-on for one more
no risk at all, but 10 runs come off the over as another single is taken to long-on
bit of width and that is thumped towards extra cover, good stop there, Guptill and Best nearly collide as the batsman completes the run and Best runs back to collect the throw
full and outside off, 136kph, a yorker outside off is squeezed out towards the off side
pitched up and that is a good-looking drive, but straight to mid-off

gone, second New Zealand batsman to depart for 47, caught by the keeper again, but this was a swirler, Williamson was going for the pull as Best drops it short, top edged it and it looped towards backward square leg, Kirk Edwards is there but he gets out of the way and leaves it to Ramdin, who completes a tricky catch
grunts as he bowls a full ball outside off, squeezed out towards point
good delivery first up for Taylor, a quick one just outside off, can't get enough bat on it and it goes onto his pads
pushed towards mid-on by Guptill
on the pads, clipped to backward square
fuller ball is driven towards long-on and Guptill moves along to 48
overpitched and on the pads, towards long-on for one more, Taylor off the mark
down the leg side, on one knee as he sweeps that behind square
eased to long-on for one more
full ball is driven towards cover by Taylor, that was 140kph from Best
short of length and on the pads, tapped towards square leg for a single
length ball is solidly driven towards the bowler, El Tino does well to get down in time to stop that
short of length ball outside off, chopped towards point, not timed too well
short of length once more, on the body, can't get it away, Guptill still on 49
what a shot to get Guptil to fifty, a lovely, effortless straight drive that zips straight back past the bowler, not all the way to the rope, but a great-looking shot that
pitched up and on the pads, driven towards mid-on where Bravo fields
eased to long-on for a single as Deonarine continues round the wicket
flighted, pitched up, driven towards long-off for another single, risk-free
towards cover this time for one more
catch him is the cry as Taylor plays it uppishly towards the bowler, Guptill also hastily dives back at the non-striker's end to make sure he is caught out of his crease
pushed towards long-off for a single
full ball outside off, is driven towards sweeper cover
beautiful hit form Guptill, full swing as he hits this length bal over Tino Best's head, very still as he played that one, four runs

whoah, that was effortless from Guptill, again it was pitched up from Best, Guptill just chips this over long-on, right off the meat of the bat, didn't look to power it even though there was a man in the deep
Guptill turning it on here, short and wide, Guptill looks to muscle it past point, bottom edges it to the third man boundary for four more
single this time, drops the ball to the off side and sets off immediately for a single
length ball on the pads, clipped to square leg, Taylor wanted one but there wasn't time so he decides against it
Narine drops it a touch short, chopped towards backward point off the backfoot
guided down to short fine leg for a single
struck on the glove there, Taylor wringing his hands after playing that one to the leg side, it bounced off a length and jammed his finger
tucked towards midwicket for a single
clipped to square leg for an easy single
a loud lbw appeal, that was turning down leg, Guptill was looking to defend it off the front foot
short of length and just outside off from Holder, defended from the crease
defended to the right of the bowler, batsman wanted a single but the non-striker didn't
short ball, a slow one, a very slow one, 97kph, Taylor was shaping for the pull, was in position very early, waits for the ball to arrive and then puts it away behind square leg for four
full ball is driven towards long-on for a single
length ball is tipped towards long-on by Guptill
yorked is dug out towards covers for a single, good ball to end the over
flighted length delivery is worked towards long-on
chopped off the backfoot towards short third man, Holder gets down in time to stop that one, 6' 7" doesn't stop Holder from fielding that
clipped behind square leg, if he had collected cleanly the batsmen would have been in trouble
tapped behind square leg
worked behind square leg
gets forward and eases that towards extra cover, for another single, six in the over
pitched up and that is driven towards long-off for a single
full ball outside off, squeezed out towards mid-off for a single
whips that length ball in front of square leg, working it with the angle, not the best effort from Miller at the boundary, conceding four
eased to long-on for one more
full ball just outside off, dug out towards extra cover
a yorker to finish the Powerplay, pushed to the right of the bowler, so 39 off the pwoerplay, slightly disappointing given the start they got off Best
punched past a diving cover for a single to bring up the 50 partnership
length ball is driven towards long-on for a risk-free single
blocked towards midwicket, a dot ball
backs away and guides it to backward point, another dot ball
steers this towards short third man for a single
down the leg side, Taylor can't connect but it is a wide anyway
Taylor is hit on the pads and looks for a single, the ball rolls near short leg, the keeper is onto it quickly, Taylor dives back towards his crease
full slower ball, thumped towards long-on, 107kph this one
pitched up and on offstump, whipped towards deep square leg, just the single
lucky for the batsman, Guptill looking for the big hit, a length ball that Guptill wanted to send beyond long-on, a thick outside edge results, the ball loops over short third man for four

Guptill perishes as he looks to step up the pace, Holder angles the ball into the batsman, Guptill doesn't get enough space to get inside the line, he launches the ball towards long-off and holes out, he wanted to get it more towards deep extra cover

dropped, the third drop off Holder, this is awaful from West Indies, McCullum looks to pull his first delivery for six, doesn't get it right off the middle, reaches Miller at deep square leg, bad miss from Miller, Holder's mood darkens
a wide down the leg side
punched towards long-on for a single
guided towards backward point for a singl
goes deep in the crease and tucks this one from off stump towards square leg
drops it short, McCullum swats it away towards deep square leg
pitched up and outside off, Taylor can't get it past backward point
full and outside off, defended in front of point for a single
quicker one, Narine concedes just three in the over as McCullum defends the final ball
slammed towards midwicket, that was short of a length, power hitting from Taylor
unlucky this time Best, pitched up and angling in towards off stump, a thick outside edge past the keeper for four
short of length well outside off, slower ball is chopped out towards point
more misfortune for Best, McCullum charges out and gets a thick inside edge this time past the keeper and down to fine leg for four, this was a full ball on leg stump
this was a tough one, Simmons charges in from the rope after McCullum muscled it towards midwicket, lands just short of him
more frustration for Best, a high full toss and a slog sends the ball straight up, Best races in to try collect that but he can't get there in time

there's the McCullum special, is there anyone in the world better at skipping out and clobbering the ball over cover? moves away leg side to make sure there was room to swing his arms, right off the middle and into the crowd
comes forward and nudges it towards mid-on for a single

charges him again and goes through with a hoick over the top, he doesn't get anywhere near enough on it as Bravo steadies himself beneath it at midwicket and holds on to a skier. Narine enticed him with the flight and the New Zealand captain took the bait.
went back and dabbed it behind point for a quick single
off spinner, dragged a bit short as he chopped it to cover, Bravo had a good bounce as he picks it up one-handed and has a shy at the stumps. Could have been quite close there
searching for the second after he shuffles across into the off side to whip the ball behind square leg, but the man in the deep is quick enough to keep them to one
lovely delivery to end, can't get under the full, off spinner as he goes forward and has to just push it back to the bowler
nicely placed from Taylor as Bravo spears this in full on leg stump from around the wicket. Nice clip towards long-on gets a couple
full toss on the pads, easy put away as Taylor gets just enough of a tickle to beat the man at short fine leg. Possibly the worst delivery you could bowl at this point
solid drive to long-on as he gets on his front foot to meet this full length ball on leg stump
slapped to long-off and Charles had to hurry. That was struck with fierce power. Opened up his stance and just hammered it away off the front foot
well bowled, that was almost a yorker on middle and Taylor can only nudge it to the right of the bowler and pick up a single
he finds the block hole again, but it's about four feet away from the batsman. Umpire has a stretch of his arms
in the slot just outside off and it was just a short-armed jab through the covers, but there was enough power in the shot to beat the man at long-off. What a strike!
length ball, turning in to the batsman who makes a little room outside leg and cuts it towards third man
went deep in his crease and made a little room for himself as well, but he slaps it straight to cover
he goes up in a hopeful appeal after a quick, flat ball on leg stump. Anderson was very slow on the flick and is struck on the pads, but that had pitched outside leg
this time he offers a bit of flight and Taylor works it away towards deep square leg for a couple

what were they doing there? Taylor chops it straight to Holder at short third man. There was no single there, but Anderson had already rushed through and Taylor had to respond. He tries his best, but the throw comes in to Narine and he whips off the bails without any fuss
swing and a miss as Narine ends with a flatter and quicker ball just outside off stump
poor start there as he offers a length ball on the pads and Ronchi picks it up and deposits it into the square leg boundary with a neat flick off his front foot

charges him and Holder responds with a quick bouncer which sails over the batsman's head. Umpire might just have been right in calling it a wide, but it was still a very hard call. Holder can't believe it
length ball on middle, whipped away through midwicket to put Anderson on strike
full and wide outside off and Anderson throws his bat at it. The thick outside edge flies away to deep third man
clears his front leg to mow the fullish ball on middle to long-on, who gets to it after the first bounce
full and a touch wide outside off and Anderson was lining up for a drill through the covers, but he didn't bother moving his feet and the ball takes the inside edge to short fine leg
looks to swing this away again, but can't connect with bat as the ball wanders over to the leg side

looks for a whack over the off side, but he misses and admonishes himself. That was a length ball and the batsman had made a bit of room to envisage the stroke as well, perhaps a bit too much in the end
full toss on off stump as he drives down the ground to long-off. Couple taken
slower short ball from Bravo as Ronchi waits for it and pulls, a bit in the air towards midwicket
moved across to off stump and wanted to slam it over midwicket, but he can't make contact. Hit on the back pad, good thing for him was he was outside the line

the stumps are rattled and Bravo likes that very much. Ronchi plants his front foot outside leg stump and looked to loft it over extra cover and it was there for the shot, only he misses it completely.
slower ball to finish as he digs it into the middle of the pitch, McCullum waits for it and uses the room outside off to dab it to point for a single
short ball around shoulder height but it wasn't quite quick enough to bother McCullum who transfers his weight back and pull it over the square leg boundary.
fullish ball speared into the pads and even as McCullum looked to swipe it over the leg side, but only manages an inside edge onto pad
they're coming back here, and McCullum makes it at the non-strikers'. It was a low full toss and Anderson got it very low on the bat as he struck down the ground but the running was excellent
fullish on middle and leg, worked away towards midwicket
right up there as McCullum opended up his stance and looked to slice it through the covers. Gets it a little high on the bat and can't beat the infield

that is way, way, way into the stands. Holder lands a length ball and Anderson accepts it gleefully. Plants his front foot outside leg stump and has ample room for a full swing of the bat and boy, did he ever nail it!

inn2.comm: starts off well as he gets a little shape away from the bat, but he had started it just a touch wide outside off stump to draw the batsman into a shot
goes back to cover the line of the back of a length ball on off stump and blocks
132 kph, lovely swing for Southee, those two slips better be alert as this is pitched on a length just outside off and the batsman refuses to play

poor cricket, very poor cricket from West Indies and they have lost Walton to a run out. It was an innocuous length ball outside off which he had dabbed towards point and was searching for a non-existent single. The call of no was a little too late and Kane Williamson had enough time to lob a perfect throw to the keeper who was running up to the stumps and find the batsman short of his ground
angled in as it pitches on off stump and moves away to beat the tentative poke outside off
full on off stump as he moves forward and blocks
131 kph, pushes it across the right-hander and keeps it right up there and the batsman flashes and misses
goes forward and looks to flay it over mid-off but the ball beats the outside edge and at pace too. Length ball, too good
beaten again, almost squared him up as the ball was back of a length on middle and moved away.
eases forward to meet the full length ball on middle with a forward defensive
fullish length ball pushed across the batsman who refrains from playing
lazy waft outside off stump as he goes for a big stroke down the ground and comes up with a whole lot of air. New Zealand bowlers showing just how much is really there in this pitch

pushed into the covers and he sets off for a quick single, but he was slowing up as he was reaching the non-strikers', trying to avoid the incoming throw probably, and he might well have been short had that hit
full length ball on off stump as he pushes to mid-off
goes just a little wide of the crease and he gets what he wants as the ball straightens after being angled in and leaves Charles poking at it unsuccessfully
dug in into the middle of the pitch and that sails over the batsman's head, unlucky not to get a wide there are West Indies
pushes the length ball down the ground
bit of room outside off stump and he flays at it off the front foot, but can't beat point
soft hands from the batsman as he nudges it behind square on the leg side and completes a much better judged single
fullish delivery working on the angle across the right-hander who goes for an ambitious drive down the ground and misses
139 kph, goes shorter and Charles stays in the crease and blocks it on off stump

135 kph, how do they do it? It was a length ball on leg stump and Charles flicked it perfectly down the throat of long leg. It looked like a lovely shot all up until the time it started descending and Charles is in complete disbelief at what he has managed to do

136 kph, that shouldn't have happened either. Good stroke from Simmons as he leant forward into the fullish ball on off stump and drove to the right of short cover. Nathan McCullum moved around from mid-off and forgot to bend down low enough to stop the ball and watches it wander away to the boundary
fuller and angled across again as Simmons pierces the gap through point and cover with another elegant drive off the front foot

overpitched on off stump and Edwards just punches it back down the ground and N Mac races after it but cannot pull it back, because the boundary line had been pulled up at long-off for some reason. Change of luck for West Indies?
bouncer target the batsman, but Edwards was quick on the back foot and pulls it down as well to pick up a second well-timed boundary
length ball just outside off stump and he gets a little shape away as well. Watchfully left alone
stays in line with the back of a length ball on off stump and blocks
short of length ball just outside off, defended from the crease to the off side
on the pads, flicked down to fine leg for a single
fuller ball, McClenaghan grunts as he delivers this one, defended to the off side
just outside off, Edwards shoulders arms
short ball, goes for the pull, he misses
another short one, this time he connects well, gets a couple to deep backward square leg
defended towards cover from the crease
skips down the track to make that a half-volley, chips that over mid-on for a boundary
plays inside the line of that one, outside off and delivered from wide of the crease, moved away after angling in
short ball at the body, doesn't bounce enough to trouble Simmons, dismissively put away behind square leg, pulled for four
pitched up and just outside off, defended towards short extra cover
short of length ball outside off, shoulders arms
that was uppish, but not carrying to point, bounces a few yards short of the fielder there
pitched up and just outside off, happy to leave that alone
shortish ball on leg stump, pulled towards deep square leg
full and down the leg side, off the pads to the keeper
full ball on off stump, squeezed out towards point
full and wide, chases that and misses
short of length and outside off, Simmons shifts the weight onto the backfoot and carves that behind point for four
clipped towards square leg for a single
length ball heading for middle, defended to the off side without much footwork
pushed towards mid-on this time
pitched up, on middle and leg, pushed towards mid-on
short of length ball on off stump, defended back towards the bowler
tucked to square leg for a single
beaten, angling across from back of a length, has a poke at it and misses
on off stump, short of length, defended from the crease
pushed towards mid-off for a quick single
short ball is pulled away with authority, behind square leg for four
short of length and on off stump, defended to the off side
steers this down to third man for a single
shortish ball, Simmons skips down the track, mistimes the drive towards cover
pushed toards cover, sets off immediately for the single, gets there though there is a direct hit
eased towards mid-off for another tight single
on middle stump, blocked to the off side from the crease
gets well back in the crease and whips that from just outside off towards midwicket
nearly a wicket first ball, Simmons drives uppishly, is inthe air for a bit, but lands just short of Anderson, off his shin as he tries to stop it
whoah! Simmons flatbats that over long-on for four, not exactly pretty, back leg in the air as he thumps that short ball to the boundary
outside off and Simmons is happy to leave the ball
on middle and off, defended from the crease towards mid-off
squeezed out towards point this time, a misfield from Williamson allows a single
not much width there to work with, blocked out towards cover
that's fifty for West Indies as Simmons pierces the gap through the off side with a nice little late cut behind point
length ball with the smallest bit of width as Edwards stays in his crease and dabs the ball to third man for another single
and that will be the fifty partnership, a much needed one which comes up as this short ball is tucked away off towards square leg with soft hands
a bit more forceful there as this one is short and has a bit of room to slap away to deep cover point
Taylor's at work down at deep point as Simmons slashes at another short ball wide of off stump. He looks quite stylish out there and doesn't lag too far behind in substance either
shortish again, but this time he tucks him up for room as Edwards goes back and whips it towards mid-on for a single

128 kph, that cut back in and Edwards was very late to adjust. He was certain this would have moved across him so he could dab to third man, but the shape back ensured the ball beat the inside edge of the bat as it came down

goes up in a concerted appeal as this one moves back in and strikes Edwards on the pads while he was moving forward. Umpire Bowden reckons it would have gone over the top of the stumps and HawkEye shows he was right. Good delivery though
shuffles across to protect his stumps and gets this off a thick outside edge through point
picked off the hips and Southee throws a bit wildly to allow the batsmen to sneak an overthrow
pulled quite strongly through midwicket as he rocks back to meet the short ball on off stump
punched straight down the ground, but mid-off is on hand to keep it to none.
length ball on middle and leg which is nicely turned through square leg for a single
very little flight as the batsman goes back and punches to the right of McCullum, who dives and covers it

leans forward to meet this full length ball on off stump and drives it towards mid-off. He sees short cover dive over it and thinks there's a single there, but Brendon McCullum swoops in on the ball and sends an accurate throw to the striker's end and Edwards can't make it. Silly cricket from West Indies, especially when they were in the midst of a recovery
a touch short and on the pads, whipped towards midwicket for a single
down towards third man for a single
chopped off the back foot towards sweeper cover
on the pads, helped towards short fine leg
tucked towards midwicket this time
Simmons steps out and looks to launch the ball, an edge results in it swirling towards cover, lands beyond the fielders
wide down the leg side
on the pads, worked behind square leg for a couple
on the pads, length ball, again clipped behind square leg
length ball outside off, defended from the crease to the off side
defended towards the bowler
length ball just outside off, more defence
worked towards deep square leg for a single
defended down the track to end the over
blocked down the track
defended towards midwicket
on the pads, tapped behind square leg
length ball on the stumps, defended off the front foot
waits on the back foot and guides this towards short third, New Zealand ripping through their overs now, as word reaches that we could be in for serious rain
defended carefully
blocked back towards the bowler
eased past cover for a single
on off stump, back of a length ball is defended to midwicket
driven to long-on for a single
gets on the back foot and eases it towards cover
worked towards midwicket this time, and that will be a game, New Zealand well ahead at this stage
length ball outside off, defended back towards the bowler
backs away and slaps it towards cover
short of length ball is defended towards cover to end another quiet over
stays on the back foot and defends behind square leg
and Simmons perishes, Simmons was tired of all the defending, looks to thrash this one over midwicket, Guptill is there near the rope to safely take that one, West Indies slide further
full ball is worked towards midwicket
length ball is defended back towards the bowler
full ball is driven towards mid-on
short of length ball on middle stump, clipped towards square leg for a single
length ball outside off, blocked off the front foot towards the off side
defended to the left of the bowler, who skips across to  cut that off
tucked away into midwicket as this was on a length on leg stump
charges him and yorks himself as he drives back to the bowler
it was sneaking down leg as Deonarine works it away towards midwicket
drills the ball through the covers
length ball on middle and off as he blocks safely
full on middle and leg as he goes forward and drives to long-on
decides to go for it but he has not got that anywhere near the middle. It was a full ball speared in at the pads and he went for the sweep. The ball sails straight to the man on the long leg boundary
nudged away to midwicket
tossed up on middle as he drives down to long-on
tossed up on leg stump as he drives back to the bowler
holds it back as he goes onto the back foot and blocks
length ball on middle and its turned away to deep square leg for a single
played towards cover
tossed up on middle and off as he comes forward and blocks
slams it over mid-off's head as he gets a bit more room outside off stump. That's a Bravo special as he gets under this flighted ball on off stump and lofts it over the top
comes forward to meet the tossed up delivery and turns it through square leg for a couple
affords room outside off again and Bravo does not miss out. Front foot reaches the pitch and lofts it over cover this time and the result is the same
turns it behind square leg for a single off a length ball on middle
tucks it away towards square leg and midwicket runs around to keep it to one.
that was on middle and leg again as he works it away to square leg for another single
stays back to punch the length ball on off stump down to mid-off
defended down the pitch
flighted outside off and this goes along with the arm to beat Ramdin's forward defensive
turns it away through midwicket for a single
drags it down but there is protection at deep midwicket as the batsman rocks back to pull the ball quite strongly
full length, not too much flight as the batsman goes back to get in line and block
goes down on one knee and sweeps the full dart away through to long leg
defended towards mid-off
flighted outside off stump as Bravo leans forward and drives one-handed to mid-off
leans forward and turns the full length ball away behind square leg

fullish delivery but Bravo prefers to stay back and looks to flick it. McClenaghan goes up in appeal as this ball strikes his pad and runs away behind square on the leg side, but it seems like he had a little bat on it
full on middle and leg as Ramdin turns it away behind square leg
cuts him in half as the length ball gets a little dip inward and Bravo was a little loose with his drive on the up through the off side
steers it off the front foot to point as this was a length ball on off stump
shortish with just enough room for Ramdin to tap it away to deep third man
fullish on off stump as he moves forward and drives the ball to mid-off and calls his partner through for the single
full on leg stump as Bravo opens up his front leg and tried to clear mid-off, but it drops just short of Southee who had been running in
flighted on middle as he comes forward and blocks
pushed into the covers for a single
it was full on middle as he turns it away towards midwicket

loud appeal from New Zealand but Umpire Bowden shakes his head. Ramdin was late on his shot and there wasn't much on offer any way as he gets rapped on the pads while being stuck in the crease, but he is saved by the height it got.
length ball on middle and is turned to square leg for a single
fullish on off stump as he moves forward to drive to mid-off
short ball targeting his midriff from around the wicket as Bravo shuffles across to off stump and pulls it away to the long leg boundary.
